original: The arrival of the French Artistic Mission in 1816 marked a pivotal moment in the evolution of Brazilian visual arts, laying the groundwork for a significant artistic renewal. Led by Joachim Lebreton, the mission aimed to reinforce the Neoclassical style, which had previously been represented in Brazil only through limited attempts. One of its key initiatives was the establishment of an Academy of Fine Arts, which was later restructured
